timeline.message:
Migrate reflective encoder to `FieldDescriptor`.

The change also adds support for `@ExtraProperty`s and `@Ignore`.

timeline.bodyText: wondering what would be the use case of LinkedHashMap?  are we going to assume the decoded json order to be associated with its getter methods?
timeline.author: James201311

replies.bodyText: oops, that was not intended. removed
replies.author: vkryachko

timeline.bodyText: if we have Annotation Processor implemented, should we just check the annotation type is registered? in that case, we may not need ExtraProperty?
timeline.author: James201311

replies.bodyText:
we still need ExtraProperty for the code-gen decoders as at compile time we don't yet know what annotations will be registered at runtime.
Additionally, having this encoder implementation make assumptions about the environment it is running it would increase coupling to that environment, not something we want.
Also note that this encoder is a singleton and it caches information about types, so it can be run by differently configured encoder contexts.
replies.author: vkryachko
